warning-block-1: All data displayed or accessible on ENVIENDOC are licensed Licence Ouverte/Open License
warning-block-2:
Before reusing the data contained on ENVIENDOC, we draw everyone’s attention to the absolute necessity of using this data taking into account the specificities of each of the databases aggregated on the site, in particular with regard to uncertainties about the quality of the data provided by each data producer. Please refer each time to the documentation of each producer.
Here you will find the most suitable links:
use-datas-content: Do you want to use the data processed by EnviEndoc? This is possible! But you must mention the resources used. For this, please refer to the document below:
use-datas-note: Note on the use of EnviEndoc resources
use-datas: If you use ENVIENDOC resources, please quote:
legacy-editor-content: Responsible for publication: Dr Sylvain CHAMOT, Médecin responsable du site d’Amiens du Centre régional de pathologies professionnelles et environnementales des Hauts-de-France & Doctorant au sein de l’Unité Mixte de Recherche UPJV/INERIS Péritox (UMR_I 01)
legacy-realisation-content: Website created as part of the Challenge Green Data for Health, based on Openlayers and its API.
legacy-datas-content: The site is exempt from reporting to the Commission Nationale Informatique et Libertés (CNIL) as it does not collect any data concerning users.
legacy-property-content: This website (texts, photographs, illustrations, logos, icons, files available for download) constitutes a work protected in France by the Intellectual Property Code, and abroad by international conventions in force on copyright. The violation of one of the copyrights of the work is an infringement offence punishable under article L.335-2 of the Intellectual Property Code, of three years imprisonment and 300 000 Euros fine.
legacy-link-content:
ENVIENDOC authorises the setting up of hyperlinks redirecting to its pages, subject to:
  • that these links are not created using the "deep link" technique and therefore that the activation of the link cannot leave any doubt about the address of the site visited and that it is displayed in a browser window independent of the original window,
  • that these links are unrelated to any website disseminating information of a discriminatory, racist, pornographic, xenophobic, pedophile nature, or that may, in general, be harmful to morality or morality.
